translations.text: All praise be to Allah, the Fashioner of the heavens and earth, Who appointed angels<sup foot_note="180551">1</sup> as His message bearers, having two, three, four wings.<sup foot_note="180552">2</sup> He adds to His creation whatever He pleases.<sup foot_note="180553">3</sup> Verily Allah has power over everything.

Whatever Mercy Allah accords to people, none can withhold; and whatever He withholds, no other will be able to release after Him.<sup foot_note="180554">1</sup> He is Most Mighty, Most Wise.<sup foot_note="180555">2</sup>

O people, remember Allah's favour upon you.<sup foot_note="180556">1</sup> Is there any creator, apart from Allah, who provides you your sustenance out of the heavens and earth? There is no god but He. Whither are you, then, being misdirected?<sup foot_note="180557">2</sup>

(O Prophet), (there is nothing novel in it) if they cry lies to you;<sup foot_note="180558">1</sup>Messengers before you were also cried lies to. To Allah shall all matters be sent back.<sup foot_note="180559">2</sup>

O people, assuredly Allah's promise is true.<sup foot_note="180560">1</sup> So let the life of the world not delude you,<sup foot_note="180561">2</sup> and let not the Deluder delude you concerning Allah.<sup foot_note="180562">3</sup>
Surely Satan is an enemy to you. Therefore, do take him as an enemy. He calls his followers to his way so that they may be among the inmates of the Fire.

A severe chastisement lies in store for those that disbelieve,<sup foot_note="180563">1</sup> but there is pardon and a great reward for those that believe and work righteous deeds.<sup foot_note="180564">2</sup>

(How<sup foot_note="180565">1</sup> awful is the straying of the person) for whom his evil deed has been embellished so that it looks fair to him?<sup foot_note="180566">2</sup> The fact is that Allah causes whomsoever He will to fall into error and shows the Right Way to whomsoever He will. So, (O Prophet), let not your life go to waste sorrowing over them.<sup foot_note="180567">3</sup> Allah is well aware of all that they do.<sup foot_note="180568">4</sup>

It is Allah Who sends forth winds which then set the clouds in motion, which We drive to some dead land giving a fresh life to earth after it had become dead. Such will be the resurrection of the dead.<sup foot_note="180569">1</sup>

He who seeks glory, let him know that all glory belongs to Allah alone. <sup foot_note="180570">1</sup> To Him do good words go up, and righteous action uplifts them.<sup foot_note="180571">2</sup> But those who contrive evil deeds,<sup foot_note="180572">3</sup> a severe punishment lies in store for them, and their contriving will come to naught.

Allah<sup foot_note="180573">1</sup> created you from dust, then from a drop of sperm,<sup foot_note="180574">2</sup> then He made you into pairs. No female conceives, nor delivers (a child) except with His knowledge. None is given a long life nor is any diminished in his life but it is written in a Book.<sup foot_note="180575">3</sup> Surely that is quite easy for Allah.<sup foot_note="180576">4</sup>

The two masses of water are not alike.<sup foot_note="180577">1</sup> The one is sweet, sates thirst, and is pleasant to drink from, while the other is salt, bitter on the tongue. Yet from both you eat fresh meat,<sup foot_note="180578">2</sup> and extract from it ornaments that you wear;<sup foot_note="180579">3</sup> and you see ships cruising through it that you may seek of His Bounty and be thankful to Him.

He causes the night to phase into the day and the day into the night,<sup foot_note="180581">1</sup> and He has subjected the sun and the moon, each running its course to an appointed term.<sup foot_note="180582">2</sup> That is Allah, your Lord; to Him belongs the Kingdom; but those whom you call upon, apart from Allah, possess not so much as the skin of a date-stone.<sup foot_note="180583">3</sup>

If you call upon them, they cannot hear your prayer. And if they hear it, they cannot answer it.<sup foot_note="180584">1</sup> On the Day of Resurrection they will disown you for associating others with Allah in His Divinity.<sup foot_note="180585">2</sup> No one can inform you of the truth save the All-Aware.<sup foot_note="180586">3</sup>
O people, it is you who stand in need of Allah;<sup foot_note="180587">1</sup> as for Allah, He is Self-Sufficient, Immensely Praiseworthy.<sup foot_note="180588">2</sup>
If He wishes, He can remove you and put in your place a new creation.
That surely is not difficult for Allah.<sup foot_note="180589">1</sup>

No one can bear another's burden.<sup foot_note="180590">1</sup> If a heavily laden one should call another to carry his load, none of it shall be carried by the other, even though he be a near of kin.<sup foot_note="180591">2</sup> (O Prophet), you can warn only those who fear their Lord without seeing Him and establish Prayer.<sup foot_note="180592">3</sup> Whoever purifies himself does so to his own good. To Allah is the final return.
The blind and the seeing are not alike,
nor darkness and light;
nor cool shade and torrid heat;

nor are the living and the dead alike.<sup foot_note="180593">1</sup> Allah makes to hear whomsoever He wishes, but you, (O Prophet), cannot cause to hear those who are in their graves.<sup foot_note="180594">2</sup>
You are no more than a warner.<sup foot_note="180595">1</sup>
We have sent you with the Truth to proclaim good news and to warn. Never has there been a nation but a warner came to it.<sup foot_note="180596">1</sup>

If they give the lie to you now, those that went before them also gave the lie to their Messengers when they came to them with Clear Proofs,<sup foot_note="180597">1</sup> with Scriptures, and with the Illuminating Book.<sup foot_note="180598">2</sup>
Then I seized those who denied the Truth, and how terrible was My punishment!
Do you not see that Allah sent down water from the sky with which We brought forth fruits of diverse hues? In the mountains there are white and red, of diverse hues, and pitchy black;

and human beings too, and beasts, and cattle � diverse are their hues.<sup foot_note="180599">1</sup>From among His servants, it is only those who know that fear Allah.<sup foot_note="180600">2</sup> Verily Allah is Most Mighty, Most Forgiving.<sup foot_note="180601">3</sup>
Surely those who recite the Book of Allah and establish Prayer and spend, privately and publicly, out of what We have provided them, look forward to a trade that shall suffer no loss;

(a trade in which they have invested their all) so that Allah may pay them their wages in full and may add to them out of His Bounty.<sup foot_note="180602">1</sup> He is Most Forgiving, Most Appreciative.<sup foot_note="180603">2</sup>

(O Prophet), the Book We have revealed to you is the Truth, confirming the Books that came before it.<sup foot_note="180604">1</sup> Verily Allah is well aware of His servants and sees everything.<sup foot_note="180605">2</sup>

Then We bequeathed the Book to those of Our servants that We chose.<sup foot_note="180606">1</sup>Now, some of them wrong themselves and some follow the medium course; and some, by Allah's leave, vie with each other in acts of goodness. That is the great bounty.<sup foot_note="180607">2</sup>
They shall enter the everlasting Gardens,<sup foot_note="180608">1</sup> shall be adorned with bracelets of gold and with pearls, and their apparel therein shall be silk.
They will say: “All praise be to Allah Who has taken away all sorrow from us.<sup foot_note="180609">1</sup> Surely our Lord is Most Forgiving, Most Appreciative;<sup foot_note="180610">2</sup>
(the Lord) Who, out of His Bounty, has made us dwell in an abode<sup foot_note="180611">1</sup>wherein no toil, nor fatigue affects us.<sup foot_note="180612">2</sup>

As for those who disbelieved, <sup foot_note="180613">1</sup> the Fire of Hell awaits them. There they shall not be finished off and die; nor will the torment (of Hell) be lightened for them. Thus do We requite every thankless being.

They will cry out in Hell and say: “Our Lord, let us out so that we may act righteously, different from what we did before.” (They will be told): “Did we not grant you an age long enough for anyone to take heed if he had wanted to take heed?<sup foot_note="180614">1</sup>Besides, there came a warner to you. So have a taste of the torment now. None may come to the help of the wrong-doers.”
Surely Allah knows the Unseen in the heavens and the earth. He even knows the secrets hidden in people's breasts.

It is He Who made you vicegerents in the earth.<sup foot_note="180615">1</sup> So whoever disbelieves will bear the burden of his unbelief.<sup foot_note="180616">2</sup> The unbelievers' unbelief adds nothing but Allah's wrath against them. The unbelievers' unbelief adds nothing but their own loss.

Say to them (O Prophet): “Have you ever seen those of your associates<sup foot_note="180617">1</sup> upon whom you call apart from Allah? Show me what have they created in the earth? Or do they have any partnership (with Allah) in the heavens? Or have We given them a Book so that they have a clear proof (for associating others with Allah in His Divinity)?”<sup foot_note="180618">2</sup> Nay, what these wrong-doers promise each other is nothing but delusion.<sup foot_note="180619">3</sup>

Surely Allah holds the heavens and the earth, lest they should be displaced there, for if they were displaced none would be able to hold them after Him.<sup foot_note="180620">1</sup>Surely He is Most Forbearing, Most Forgiving.<sup foot_note="180621">2</sup>

Swearing by Allah their strongest oaths they claimed that if a warner came to them they would be better-guided than any other people.<sup foot_note="180622">1</sup> But when a warner did come to them, his coming only increased their aversion (to the Truth).

They began to wax even more proud on earth and contrived evil designs although the contriving of evil designs only overtakes their authors. Are they waiting, then, for anything except what happened to the nations before them?<sup foot_note="180623">1</sup> You shall not find any change in the Way of Allah; and you shall not find anything that can ever alter the Way of Allah.

Have they not journeyed in the earth to behold the end of those who went before them though they were stronger than them in might? Nothing in the heavens nor on earth can frustrate Him in the least. He is All-Knowing, All-Powerful.

If Allah were to take people to task for their deeds, He would not leave any living creature on earth, but He grants them respite to an appointed time. When their appointed time comes to an end, surely Allah fully observes His servants.
